thread.title: Sixties icon Lulu to perform in Hampshire
thread.title_full: Sixties icon Lulu to perform in Hampshire

title: Sixties icon Lulu to perform in Hampshire
text:
0 comments 
SIXTIES singing sensation Lulu will celebrate five decades in showbiz with a Concorde Club date as part of a 20-show UK tour next spring. 
An Evening With Lulu will feature hits from her 50-year career, including favourites such as Take That collaboration Relight My Fire, legendary Shout, Bond theme The Man With the Golden Gun and Eurovision hit Boom Bang A Bang. 
The Grammy nominated Scottish singer will visit Eastleigh on March 6. 
Songs from the back catalogue of soul legends Ray Charles and Otis Redding will get Lulu’s throaty treatment and audiences can enjoy personal anecdotes, songwriting experiences and other entertaining stories. 
Lulu said: “2015 has been an exceptional year for me, in a 50-year career. From performing at Glastonbury, releasing my first self-penned album and touring the UK solo with my fabulous band for the first time in ten years. 
“I had so much fun I’ve decided to get back out there to do it again in March 2016, and I can’t wait!” Share article 
The Scottish songstress had her first hit at the age of 15 with a cover of The Isley Brothers’ Shout. Across her career, Lulu has released 21 albums and even won the Eurovision Song Contest in 1969. 
Tickets go on sale on Friday at 9am from ticketmaster.co.uk. Promoted Stories Sixties icon Lulu to perform in Hampshire
